epd_owner_contact.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by_contact.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certified_by_contact.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.functional_properties: Pre and post tension, General use concrete (Including: Foot paths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete)

concrete_classes.name: Normal-class
concrete_classes.description: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.

concrete_classes.name: Special-class
concrete_classes.description: Typically supplied to major construction projects from high rise buildings, dams and spillways, roads, bridges to public works infrastructure etc. May include high-strength/high-performance, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and other decorative applications.

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.candidate_list_substances: None present above 0.1% of product weight
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options, modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
The Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
impact_categories_calculated_manually: Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
lca_information.allocation: Intermediate flows allocated physically based on weight (quarries) or based on m3 of concrete (batching plant). Economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible. Fly ash and silica fumes are waste products and burden-free. Ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed in production are not accounted for. Personnel-related impacts are also excluded. No energy or mass flows, except packaging of materials, were excluded.
lca_information.data_quality: All data sources were scored good or very good. Background data sources updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14.

geographic_and_temporal_coverage.material: Cement Supplier data and EPD factors

upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials
Generation of electricity from primary and secondary energy resources, including extraction, refining and transport
core_processes: External transportation of materials to the core processes and internal transport
Manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing, which occurs in the mixing truck and is considered part of the A4 module)
Treatment of waste and wastewater generated from the manufacturing processes
downstream_processes: Installation of the ready-mix concrete on the site
Wastage of construction products (accounted for in module A5)
Transport of equipment and use of materials for deconstruction at the end of life
Transport of waste generated at the end of life
Treatment of waste generated at the end of life
lca_information.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates the environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete.

installation.assumptions: Inputs account for pouring of concrete from a ready-mix truck and pump, excluding pre-installation activities such as site work and forms. Concrete slabs are manually finished. No additional inputs required to be modelled.

construction_inputs_and_waste.parameter: Concrete losses that go to landfill

deconstruction.process: Physical process of drilling and removing the concrete. Hydraulic excavator is assumed as the operating tool for deconstruction. Based on ecoinvent v3.9.1 (2023) database.

end_of_life.notes: 80% recycling rate based on the 2022 National Waste Report (DCCEEW, 2023).

industry_context.2030_target: Embodied carbon of all construction materials needs to be at least 40% lower.
industry_context.2050_target: All new construction materials need to be net zero.

electricity_mix_gwp.energy_sources: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)
Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)
Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)
Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)
Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from the atmosphere through carbonation, a chemical reaction between CO2 and hydration products. This process can offset some CO2 emissions over the concrete's lifetime.
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results tables.

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: Co-products are considered as such per BS EN 16757:2017. Impacts for their production process are allocated according to PCR 2019:14. Default background data from LCA databases used.
recycled_materials_handling.fly_ash: AusLCI process treats as waste material; only transport impacts included.
recycled_materials_handling.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: AusLCI process allocated based on economic value.
recycled_materials_handling.silica_fume: Ecoinvent process treats as waste material; only transport impacts included.
recycled_materials_handling.secondary_data_allocation: AusLCI allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes. AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 for allocation.
